item.title: Ticket #3480 (memory leak in wp-includes/functions.php line 818) updated
item.dc:creator: mattbta
item.description: Owner, Status, Component, Milestone changed

item.title: Ticket #3480 (memory leak in wp-includes/functions.php line 818) updated
item.dc:creator: mattbta
item.description: Milestone changed

item.title: Ticket #3480 (memory leak in wp-includes/functions.php line 818) created
item.dc:creator: mattbta
item.description:
Background:

IIS 6, PHP 5.2.0, MySQL 5.0.27, Wordpress 2.0.5

I noticed that I couldn't get into my admin panel...it would just time out but the rest of the site functioned well. After 8 hours or so, I would come back and I would be getting a PHP error stating that allocated memory was exhausted and cited wp-includes/functions.php line 818. I restarted IIS and let it run over the next couple of days and it would end up getting the PHP error again.

That line has to do with comments (return get_object_vars($_comment);). I hopped in phpmyadmin and there were 300+ new comment spams. I performed a "delete from wp_comments where comment_approved = 'spam';" and that took care of the issue for the time being. I haven't had time to peek into the code to recommend a patch. Just wanted to make the crew aware of the issue.

item.title: Ticket #3479 (Add filter for incoming trackbacks) created
item.dc:creator: tenpura
item.description:
Since there is no way to implement almighty input encoding conversion method, we definitely need a filter to bypass or reimplement the current one.

I found that the current code destroys several types of encodings, and thus this could be a good solution for it too.

item.title: Ticket #3478 (Title of private posts show up in dashboard) created
item.dc:creator: McShelby
item.description: When a user A logs in to Wordpress he cannot actually see the comments attached to a private post of some other user B, but he can see the title of the post on the Dashboard page. There's a link under "Latest Activity >> Comments" which shows the title of the private post which has recently had a comment attached to it. If user A clicks on the post title link, he correctly gets the 404 page. However the title of user B's private post was revealed.

item.title: Ticket #3397 (Occasional dbx.js cookie-related JS error) updated
item.dc:creator: markjaquith
item.description: We'll look at a DBX upgrade for 2.0.7

item.title: Ticket #3397 (Occasional dbx.js cookie-related JS error) updated
item.dc:creator: intoxination
item.description: The problem I have noticed is if you install Wordpress twice in the same domain/sub-domain. If that happens, the cookies from both installs conflict with each other. This problem only seems to occur on 2.0.X. The 2.1 branch is not affected (I have 3 copies on the same domain with no problem).

item.title: Ticket #3476 (<object> elements should not be put on their own line by wpautop) updated
item.dc:creator: JeremyVisser
item.description:
I presume it's there because people post YouTube videos on the same line as the text, making the last line of the text go down to the bottom of the video.

But yeah, that's a bit funky.

item.title: Ticket #3476 (<object> elements should not be put on their own line by wpautop) created
item.dc:creator: Viper007Bond
item.description:
I don't know where to begin, but it needs a major overhaul.

For example, make a post with this: 

Test<object>Blah</object>

That's perfectly valid XHTML.

It results in this: 

<p>Test<br />
<object>Blah</object>

No closing </p> and a <br /> that shouldn't be there.

It also really likes putting <br />'s inside <object> tags even when there was no line break there.

The list goes on an on and it affects more than just <object> tags. As I said, I dunno where to start...

item.title: Ticket #3464 (Category delete AYS prompt incorrectly states outcome of category deletion) updated
item.dc:creator: markjaquith
item.description:
Instead, posts only in the deleted category are set to the category <strong>%s</strong> and links only set to this category are set to <strong>%s</strong>

I'm not 100% on this. How about: 

Instead, posts that were only assigned to the deleted category are set to the category <strong>%s</strong> and links that were only assigned to the deleted category are set to <strong>%s</strong>

That makes the wording more consistent with the wording in the JS alert() portion of your patch, which I like.

item.title: Ticket #3464 (Category delete AYS prompt incorrectly states outcome of category deletion) reopened
item.dc:creator: foolswisdom
item.description:
Hi John,
Thanks for the patch, don't market tickets fixed though. Someone with commit access will when a fix is checked in.
Wording looks good.
